author: Jess Bravin
title: Supreme Court Rules Lawyer Can’t Say Client Did It When Defendant Claims Innocence
text:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court said Monday that a criminal defendant retains the right to declare his innocence, even when his attorney believes the only chance to avoid execution is to confess guilt in light of overwhelming evidence against him.
The 6-to-3 decision means a new trial for Robert McCoy, who was convicted after his lawyer told a Bossier Parish, La., jury that while “my client committed three murders,” his “serious mental and emotional issues” justified leniency. The gambit failed, as the jury returned three death...
